meanings.definition: The quality of being pertinacious or persistent in holding to a course of action or belief; stubbornness.
meanings.sent1: Her pertinaciousnesses in pursuing her dreams paid off in the end.
meanings.sent2: His pertinaciousnesses in sticking to his principles earned him respect from others.
meanings.sent3: Despite his pertinaciousnesses in trying to teach his cat tricks, the feline remained unimpressed.
meanings.sent4: The pertinaciousnesses of the old tree roots breaking through concrete symbolized nature's unstoppable force.
meanings.sent5: The pertinaciousnesses of the toddler trying to fit the square block into the round hole was both amusing and admirable.

meanings.definition: The state of being pertinacious or persistent in holding to a course of action or belief; stubbornness.
meanings.sent1: The pertinaciousnesses of the student in studying for the exam were evident in his late-night sessions.
meanings.sent2: Over time, her pertinaciousnesses in advocating for animal rights led to significant changes in legislation.
meanings.sent3: The pertinaciousnesses of the stubborn door refusing to open became a running joke among the residents.
meanings.sent4: The pertinaciousnesses of the weeds growing through the cracks in the pavement showed nature's resilience.
meanings.sent5: His pertinaciousnesses in perfecting his recipe for apple pie made him a local baking legend.
